repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
6 orphan folios foliated:
f17-f18 (= Arabic library foliation 1-2) contain numbered verses.
f21, f88-f90 (= Arabic library foliation 3-6) contain unnumbered stanzas organized in columns. There is no commentary.

Vinson suggested that these fragments belong to an epic poem, perhaps the Tēmpāvaṇi, but a quick search for words in the verses on the digital text of the Tēmpāvaṇi on the Tamil Virtual Academy website has yielded not results. These verses do not seem to belong to that poem.
These folios are in fact part of BnF Indien 499.
Description by M. Trento based on the examination of the original manuscript.
Recto and verso of f21 (= Arabic library foliation 3) are inverted on the Gallica images.

supportDesc.foliation: Original discontinuous Tamil foliation. Consecutive roman numeration (1-6) added in pencil on the lm near to the original foliation.

collation.desc: 6 folios = Text not identified. Tamil foliation 17-18, 21, 88-90 = Arabic pencil library foliation 1-6.

supportDesc.condition: Themanuscript is in decent conditions, legible, but the right margin of some folios has partially disintegrated.

layoutDesc.layout: No columns for f17-f18. 3-column layout for f21, f88-f90.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1750 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not dated by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1852, since part of the collection of Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852).

acquisition.p: Received in 1870, from “Madame Burnouf”. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1350.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 67, no. 476.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 109r, no. 439 476.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Converted to TEI by Charles Li.
Revised and enlarged by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
Revised and enlarged by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 2, January 2023.
